website_summaries.verdict: Tall and thin tower holds a lot of media, yet it doesn't require a lot of floor space.
pros: Narrow media storage cabinet fits in a lot of different locations in your home
Includes a wall anchor system for safety
Very inexpensive unit versus other media storage options
Will accommodate all kinds of media
cons: Not the most stable media storage cabinet

website_summaries.verdict: Good price point for a simple media storage tower where you can adjust shelf sizes.
pros: Narrow design, so it won't occupy a lot of space along your wall
Includes a wall anchor system so it won't accidentally tip
Can create shelves of varying heights to accommodate multiple types of media
Assembly is easier than some other more complex media tower products
cons: Small unit that only holds 120 DVDs

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk! I realize it is not an expensive item, but I would have hoped for at least decent quality. First cam lock broke with one turn, vaneer chipped while putting it together at the slightest bump, some vaneer didn't even reach end of board.. not worth time to disassemble and put back in box, to send for refund. I have bought a number of "build yourself" pieces, and have had no problems, in the past. This is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!  Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.text: I wound-up literally spending hours in my attempt to put this hideous thing together! The instructions were a mess, with some diagrams showing some parts to be upside-down, or referred to nails as "screws"; many of the shelf pieces didn't have a sticker with their part number on them, resulting in my having to disassemble and reassemble from time to time; a number of the holes were misdrilled, and, almost finished, I found that I was one dowel short and called the distributor to send me one! Ergo, it's not complete yet! Since its the only shelf that will fit in the space I have, I'm going to keep the wobbly sucker--at least until it collapses of its own weight!
customer_reviews.author: MPO

customer_reviews.title: It's Cheap and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you are paying don't expect something luxurious...it gets the job done and is fairly good at that. If you are looking for something cheap and just want to store your Manga/Books/Video games then this is perfect for that. Just the right size for someone who is starting off. Plus it comes with these plastic clips that help keep it in place on a wall if the ground isn't perfectly flat. In short, it's a solid product that isn't perfect(has some wear) but I'm happy with the purchase and looks nice in my room.
customer_reviews.author: Jmodrak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. Don't waste your money. We bought similar ones at Office Depot or Staples (can't remember which) for $19.99 some years back and loved them. We bought this because it looks the same and we had run out of space. My husband had to replace plastic screws that broke while positioning them. Nothing fit together properly. It is rickety and unstable. Biggest waste of $36 I have spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Venetia J. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Pressed cardboard with flimsy veneer. Was not able to assemble without scratching veneer. Not attractive when assembled. 2 holes in the top for attaching to the wall. Why not the back? Instructions say screws attach the back, but they are nails, and require a hammer! The last thing you want is to try to hammer this delicate product. Waste of $.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hill

customer_reviews.title: Potentially good unit ruined by shoddy materials...
customer_reviews.text: Somebody had a good idea for an easy-to-assemble media cabinet — but then produced it on the cheap so that the cabinet ends up being useless. This is a very good example of getting what you pay for. The materials are so shoddy that it's impossible to assemble without threatening the integrity of the construction. You end up with a waste of time and money that you wouldn't ever use to store anything of value. I'm tossing mine into the basement (where the shelving might be able to support old rags) and heading out to buy something more reliable. It won't cost that much more, either.
customer_reviews.author: JRNJ

customer_reviews.title: Helpful hint for the last step.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, a decent storage unit. When putting the tower together, I used some glue (even though the instructions didn't call for it) when placing the dowels into the sides of the panels. The last step includes flipping the unit over and hammering 34 little nails into the back to install the panel. Once the unit is turned over and before you start swinging the hammer, I would recommend placing one (1) support piece at the front (top) of the unit (use some of the Styrofoam in the packing) and two (2) more pieces where the 2 permanent shelves are installed about 1/3 and 2/3 of the way down.
customer_reviews.author: In the Dena

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little storage unit to stand up in our theater room. I read the reviews and took the tips that other buyers provided. Among these was using wood glue in addition to the screws provided. I also got out my brad nailer (nail gun) to put the back on. Lay both pieces on the back, straighten them and use the gun. Yes, it’s well worth the hassle of getting your compressor and nail gun out! Additionally, I used small picture hanger loops and wire to secure it to the wall instead of the too large nails and brackets that came with it. The shelves are adjustable to accommodate different disks. I recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rack for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble! I always use wood glue on the pressed composition wood this makes for a much better joint of the parts and a very rigid case when completed. The directions are not intricate but are simple with corresponding letters as to what parts are used. Use the letter bags to keep the metal fasteners organized so they don’t get mistaken for one another during assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Farley

customer_reviews.title: Extremely wobbly. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Assembling was easy. Does hold a substantial amount of blu rays. Cheap material as you get what you paid for. Of note, this shelf is extremely unsteady and requires the backboard and blu rays to keep the weight in place. Does not last after a relocation. Was moving recently and the sides started detaching along its three parts. The screws were on tightest they can be during transport and still loose, detaching, and wobbly. I do not recommend. Buy a better shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Carl the Practical Murse

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The long side panels are actually 3 separate sections. I successfully assembled two of them. While assembling the third, tightening the screw that secures the horizontal shelf to the vertical panel section caused the panel to crack, so the screw could not be tightened and the unit could not be fully assembled. Since repacking and returning it would only be a further hassle, the whole thing ended up in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble, light weight, and does the job I asked of it. I used to work at a furniture store assembling things like these all day, and this one is no different than other cheap and small particle board units you're going to buy. However, it is very flimsy. The screws were so flimsy that when the thing was fully assembled, I ended up having to use some wood glue to stop if from wobbling in one place. Despite that, I am pretty happy with it. Instructions were clear and everything I needed was in the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Extrenely difficult
customer_reviews.text: This unit was extremely difficult and frustrating as heck to put together. Just when you think you have figured it out and add the next shelf, the whole thing falls apart like a house of cards! We went to Christmas Tree Shop and found a better product for half the price! I gave it one star in each category, but the product isn't worth any stars! So happy I could return it and get all my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy E.

customer_reviews.title: Good but be careful when assembling
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice basic media tower. It looks pretty good and helps keep items organized neatly. However, be careful during assembly, especially when nailing in the back panels. When it is face down, do not apply too much pressure or hammer too hard. This is because the bottom "foot" does not allow the tower to lie flat. I hammered too hard (without even trying), which caused some of the dowels to pull out and one of the particle board joints to tear apart. It still works and I'll probably never have a problem, but it is now broken. (If you get the product, you'll eventually see what I mean.) Buy it and assemble carefully!
customer_reviews.author: Mr V

customer_reviews.title: Looks great in the picture
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in the picture, but since it has to be assembled in a multi-layer way on top of one another, the upper shelves tend to crumble because of the clumsy of assembly, the upper shelves tend to crumble, unless the top is nailed or screwed to an adjacent furniture or wall!
customer_reviews.author: Nothanks

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time isn't the charm
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased in a month. The first one I bought was espresso coloured and bought this one a couple weeks after because I loved the first one so much. This one was the opposite. Box was damaged on arrival and several pieces inside had dings and tears in them. The screw holes in this one were too wide so screwing the screws in didn't really do anything. It's EXTREMELY wobbly and the sides don't really hold into place even with the dowels and screws. Pretty disappointed. Was planning on buying a third one but will find something else.
customer_reviews.author: CallMeBW

customer_reviews.title: Can only hold 5 shelves of Blu Rays, maybe 4 shelves of regular-sized DVDs.
customer_reviews.text: Broke in half when we were putting it together- be careful about the weight you put on it! Very flimsy. We were able to get it back together and it stands just fine filled with blu rays, but only by using extra screws and nails in places they weren't supposed to go. :/ A lot smaller than in the picture. Can hold 5 shelves of only blu rays. The picture shows 8 shelves and a lot of empty space. I had 3 shelf planks left over.
customer_reviews.author: Fraeyalise

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these cabinets and I love them. Easy to assemble, looks really nice. I put my smaller music boxes and collectible pitchers on some of the shelves and they look very nice there among the DVDs and CDs. My suggestion is to attach the bottom shelf on last after turning it over on it's back where it lays flat.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: After I separated the parts, it went together fairly easily. All the parts were there and they were pre-drilled and cut perfectly. There was one small error in the directions, but it won't go together if you try to do it the way it is pictured, so it is easy to get past, and from there on you don't really need the directions. it is pretty lightweight, so they give you hardware to attach to a wall. I chose to attach to the bookcase it stands next to.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Fit a lot of cds into a narrow gap
customer_reviews.text: This was not difficult to assemble. It took about 75 minutes. There were a couple parts that were not labeled; figuring what was what took an extra 10 minutes. I paid the extra $10 to color match my existing furniture. The unit is over-priced. Compared to kits that I've made in the past, this should only cost $30. It's particle board, so it's easy to damage during household moves. As long as you stay put it should work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Signor

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Instructions on How to Put Together, Screws Didn't Even Fit Correctly
customer_reviews.text: The overall product wasn't bad for the price, but it was damaged and the (k) screws didn't even fit correctly. The way you attach the pack panels are pain in the butt! It's not that sturdy, quality is ok, it moves a lot because the way it's put together is not ideal. Instruction is terrible. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: AZM_reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as i needed the extra storage space.Right size,easy to build,right height as this sits next to another storage unit i had purchased before,i am pleased with the fact that these 2 storage unit snug up against each other very nicely,they are worth the purchase,i use mine for cd and blu ray storage,don't know how they would hold up with anything heavy placed in them.They are pressed chipboard construction.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Johns

customer_reviews.title: A few missing prts
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars because there were not enough dowels to match the need. The piece came together without them but would be more sturdy with them. I assembled myself in about an hour being very slow and careful. The final product is good and I will use it as a pantry, for canned goods. .
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect storage shelves
customer_reviews.text: Never enough bathroom storage so I bought this shelf unit to store extra shampoo, toothpaste, deodorant, — many needed toiletries. It matches my bedroom furniture and fit easily between my dresser and closet doors, out of the way. Easy to assemble and works for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Lover

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention when assembling
customer_reviews.text: Will work perfect for space I have, should have ordered double but alas.... When assembling pay attention to detail, there are finished and not finished edges on the pieces, be sure to assemble with this in mind, otherwise you will need to disassemble and change pieces around. But assembly is pretty straight forward, just follow directions.
customer_reviews.author: Softpaww

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. For the price exceeded my expectations. I didn't like that the holes in the side to divide the shelf were put on an awkward possition. I ended up with 4 DVD shelf's and 4 weird spaces in between were I can fit barely nothing. I wish they just holed the whole side and that way we would had the choice to divide as we want. Instructions aren't simple. But easy to follow if u have experience with these kind of stuff in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Bgrr

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble, the pieces fit well together and I appreciated that the unit could be anchored to a wall. I was looking for a functional shelf to paint and slide into a dark corner, so I can't really comment about the aesthetic finish. It will need a good gripper primer (I bought the light color), certainly chalk paint does not adhere well without an undercoat. It ended up with a random wash effect without. I didn't mind as the shelf sits in shadow and the effect worked for me. It seems strong enough for its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: The unit is just OK for the price. The material, it's made from, is a cheap laminated pressed fiberboard that can break easy with stress. The quality control during manufacturing is terrible. The very bottom piece, that sets on the floor, is backwards. The holes are drilled in the wrong location which requires the part to be install with the rough edge facing outward. And, because this is the last part of the assembly makes it difficult, if not impossible, to disassemble for a return. I glued all the joints during assembly so I cannot take it apart for a return, so I just accepted my losses and moved on. You should be cautious about this product!
customer_reviews.author: dlnardia

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these....They weren't difficult to assemble...one tip...just watch for the "front" "back"...front has a veneer...the back has a particle board look....also, the directions say "screws" to attach the back....don't look for them...they meant very small nails which were included. These were exactly what I wanted for my many CDs. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly and good looking finished tower.
customer_reviews.text: From the time UPS delivered the box until this until was completely assembled took less than an hour. All the needed pieces were included, the pre-drilled holes all aligned properly and the assembly instructions were easy to follow. I heeded the warnings from others and did not over tighten any of the fittings and had no problems at all getting the unit together. It is attractive and will serve the intended purpose. For the record, I am a mechanically inclined female.
customer_reviews.author: MTnative

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price they are what I expected. I ended up ordering two for our needs and ended up breaking 2 of the small wooden dowels on the first one. Having a few extra included would have been nice but it wasn't a deal breaker. With the second I used wood glue on each dowel and between each tier and it seemed to help sturdy it up a bit. Both lean to the back quite a bit, so I suggest placing up against a wall and using the anchor kit provided if you have pets or infants.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Looks good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good - looking unit for a low price, reasonably sturdy for cd or dvd storage. Kind of a pain to assemble, and I wouldn't put anything heavy on it. This unit is not designed for storing your old dictionaries or encyclopedias (unless they're on disc). Use reasonable caution in tightening screws, and you should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Wilhelmina

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my needs. I am able put CD's and DVD's on it because the shelves are adjustable. It is tall and thin so the ability to attach it to the wall is necessary to keep it from tipping forward. It came with the hardware to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Kayaker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: One of the CAM locks broke and I had to use a drill and screws to secure the shelf because that one broken CAM lock made it so unstable. Had that not broken (or had there been an extra), it would have been very easy to assemble and fairly solid. I definitely suggest anchoring it to the wall as it can easily be tipped over by kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Completely what I expected- I will note that at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Completely what I expected- I will note that at the end of the instructions when it comes to putting the back on- it instructs you tokay the piece facedown to hammer in the nails that hold it in place. I don’t suggest this because it puts stress on the joints between the shelf pieces and caused mine to crack making it wobbly. I pulled the shelf apart and hammered the joint deeper into the board, so it’s fixed. But hindsight it shouldn’t be laid on it’s front at all.
customer_reviews.author: Freya Lea

customer_reviews.title: Good Looks, Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: This unit was a little tricky for me to put together. It is lightweight, so I handled it with great care. I made sure to load the CDs on the bottom shelves first and have the unit firmly up against a wall. I would not recommend it near where you might bump into it or where children might play, but safely up against a wall will be fine, and it looks very good!
customer_reviews.author: Ludwika Goodson

customer_reviews.title: however I was at wit's end with what to do with easily 200 cassette tapes I needed to store in an ...
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting much, however I was at wit's end with what to do with easily 200 cassette tapes I needed to store in an accessible manner. I ordered this and was amazed at how easy it was to put together. (Note: I added wood glue to the slots and along the sides that fit together to insure a good, stable assembly.) The whole thing was standing in about an hour, and the best surprise is that ALL of my old cassette collection fit inside, using all the shelves and making two parallel/horizontal rows on each shelf. For the money, could not have asked for more!
customer_reviews.author: L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Put it all togather, carefully lifted to bring up stair and it C OMPLETLY FELL apart. Totally CRAP wood split..partical board came apart. Had to go cut braces, glue and NAIL it back together This shelf is CRAP
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Peterson

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for cd storage. It’s a little flimsy compared to the IKEA one I already own, but it does get the job done. Easy to put together if you follow the simple written instructions. It’s not fantastic because it is cheap pressboard, but as I said, it gets the job done. Clean lines and everything fits as described in the description. Took less that 20 minutes to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: space saving
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my bathroom which is so tiny. I use it to keep my grooming needs in order and to hold extra cleaning supplies, works great for this. I ordered 4 more to use ..in my other bathroom, one for kitchen to hold a few can goods, and back porch to hold other supplies. They take up less space then a normal cabinet which is great for my needs. This might not been what they was design for but they could not work better for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ollabell

customer_reviews.title: Great for graphic novels/manga too
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great, cute little shelf that’s great for manga and graphic novels! I saw the other review which said it works for manga and bought it, I like it! I was looking for something small to store some of my growing collection, this holds about 100 manga/volumes. It’s pretty sturdy, had some trouble assembling at first but I got the hang of it after a bit. It’s a good cheap solution for a manga shelf, but will only hold six shelves of books— which isn’t that bad! I think the extra shelves are for if you wanted to use this for tiny media like CDs. Overall good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Glue is the answer for sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: Product is solid. After reading many reviews, I realized the answer to many issues is GLUE. The instructions don't mention it, but filling all the holes with a little bit of glue will make the unit solid.
customer_reviews.author: Krupa B

customer_reviews.title: Get down on the floor to read CDs on the bottom shelves
customer_reviews.text: It does store a lot of CDs. I haven't tried binoculars yet, but selecting from bottom shelves is strictly a job to be done on hands and knees. Easier with DVDs. The search continues for perfect CD rack.
customer_reviews.author: RouseOKC

customer_reviews.title: Nice shelves for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Just as nice as the bigger set I bought earlier. I bought this set to add to the amount of storage on the first larger set I bought. Shelves are sturdy and not too deep thus offering space saving if you are storing dvd's.
customer_reviews.author: fortunato

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wood cheaper than expected
customer_reviews.text: Couple of the nails flattened and very cheap board split when drilling screws in would not recommend making it work :(((. the veneer chipped too but in a spot that where screw went into and hidden by dvds
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Assemble by hand. Do not use power tools.
customer_reviews.text: Much better product than I expected. It actually held one more CD than predicted. Easy to assemble once you get it going. Only use a Phillips head screwdriver, do not use a power screwdriver, you do not need it, and you will get better results by not over torquing it.
customer_reviews.author: Phantomfire1

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I've ordered and they're just right for my DVD & CD collection! For the price and ease of delivery and size ( I live in a small apartment) you can't do better!
customer_reviews.author: royal candace

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good assembly directions
customer_reviews.text: Good storage unit for the price. Pretty sturdy but i would recommend using the wall anchor that is provided. I really like the widely adjustable shelves. Be really sure to keep checking to make sure you have the right side facing out consistently as you assemble. I managed to nail 1/3 of the back on before i realized it was wrong side out.... glued some lovely shelf paper inside. Problem solved. I added wood glue to the dowel holes and some seams to add a little stability.
customer_reviews.author: Janet C

customer_reviews.title: Its small but works. I'm going to buy a 2nd one and put them on either side of tv stand
customer_reviews.text: Its exactly what i thought it would be. Its small but it's perfect for my needs. Holds about 100 dvd and 130 blue ray. Take the time to separate all the parts and hardware. Read instructions and it will go together pretty easy. Don't over tighten or u could strip out the screws in the particle board.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Bernard

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...and that’s not much
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for...and that’s not much. Particle/chipboard. Two pieces arrived broken. After seeing the broken boards and what crap this is, even at the price charged, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Cd tower sufficient for cabin use.
customer_reviews.text: The product had a chip in the laminate in the side panel but will keep. Size is about what is expected. We used for CDs and have extra room for more. Made in China so was made with pressed wood with a laminate exterior.
customer_reviews.author: Sharrona

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: If not careful you can break wood while putting together, would not trust around kids unless attached to wall if sitting on carpet. Otherwise it is nice looking and stores a good amount of dvds
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Grate stand
customer_reviews.text: Gtate stand was very well made and easy to put together with simple step-by-step instructions the stand was able to fit all my DVDs. This stand is a good price for the money would recommend to buy.
customer_reviews.author: brandon mcmillen

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is not the best shelf out there, but it gets the job done. The shelves are pretty narrow, but it was designed for DVDs so it makes sense. I have books on some of the shelves but you can't fit a whole lot. If you want something easy to build and low cost, then you should buy this shelf.
customer_reviews.author: zx9rt1

customer_reviews.title: Holds CD's and DVD's abundantly
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit hard to assemble; I goofed up on a step or two but I wasn't going to pay the assembly price! I love this unit. It's slim and holds more than I need now. Nice neutral color that matches my office furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Preuhs

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done! This item is a nice, petite shelf. I got it for storing my tshirts to free up room in my closet and it works fine for that. Comes with plenty of shelving that you can customize to your purpose. Not the sturdiest thing, as it is tall and narrow, but I threw a bag of potting soil on the bottom shelf and it seems alright! Read the dimensions and consider the purpose before buying, but for lightweight items or knick knacks this will do you just fine. Assembly was fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Nicer than I was expecting based on some of the reviews but I needed something for my dvds. Another reviewer recommended putting on the 'base' piece after you've assembled the rest of it and I totally agree!
customer_reviews.author: T. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage Option
customer_reviews.text: I am a crafter - I am organized. I store all of my stamp and die combos in clear DVD cases. I use the Avery dvd insert template to print a description of what's inside, on the spine of the case. The clear cases fit perfectly! The tower is sturdy and sits close to the wall - perfect solution!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen J Holcombe

customer_reviews.title: Personally Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My boys love it. Holds their games and DVDs perfectly. Nice, slim design is unobtrusive. Arrived on time and undamaged. Could be a little sturdier without having to anchor it to the wall. Still giving it 5 stars and am ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: CY

customer_reviews.title: IT SERVED ITS PURPOSE FOR WHAT i NEEDED IT FOR
customer_reviews.text: When i WAS Putting it together at the end one of the nails split one shelf, I don't want to send it back I just need 1 replacement shelf
customer_reviews.author: Carmine J. Pampalone

customer_reviews.title: Worthless and waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of crap. Not even worth wasting the gas of shipping it. Well-packaged but the first/top half won’t even stay assembled long enough to build the bottom half. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: Got together with hard work
customer_reviews.text: Put it together every thing was going good until I put the bottom parts together and I went to put the back panel's on and the bottom part fell off but I got it put all together and finished it a little disappointed but all together now and using it
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. Crass

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. May have balance issues if not on a flat surface.
customer_reviews.text: About 25 blueray cases and 19 dvd cases per row and 6 rows total. I placed a weight in the bottom to make it lean back into the wall because the carpet is not perfectly flat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY good product.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bookshelf, very fun and easy to assemble. Looks beautiful, it is smaller than j had anticipated or pictures show but it's perfect for what I need. Will consider getting another one. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Solaire

customer_reviews.title: For the price it’s good.  Does the job.  Sturdy once assembled
customer_reviews.text: Take your time putting it together. It’s particle board so don’t tighten screws like it’s hardwood. Once assembled it’s sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: paul m gossert

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Went together without any issues. I did glue the dowels, as most of them were a pretty loose fit. I also used an electric screwdriver on a low torque setting for the screws and cam screws. Only suggestion I have is to make sure you block the front of the cabinet when nailing on the back (doesn't fit flush with the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Stonehollow

customer_reviews.title: Visible Top Piece Scratched Upon Delivery
customer_reviews.text: The top piece to the shelf was scratched and then packed and shipped. It’s disappointing to own a damaged product like this for the cost. It’s too expensive and inconvenient to send back. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jared C.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful size
customer_reviews.text: Assembly can be a bit tricky so put it together and make sure finished edges are lined up front and back before you apply glue. Fairly sturdy and nice size, we have multiple units so they are flexible and easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: Ora Moose

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Came in a nice tight box, no damage on any parts. It took me about 30 minutes to assemble, no problems. It has a total of 8 inside shelf areas, but if you are using it for DVDs, then you will only use 6. For CDs, you can use all 8. Looks nice enough for pressboard. Overall, I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Cktine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Feels stable. I bought one because I ran out of room for my other big cd towers (have around 1,300 cds) this helped me file in the cds I've bought over the last year.
customer_reviews.author: Sid CeaserTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A good utilitarian CD or DVD storage unit...
customer_reviews.text: I put this together yesterday with no effort and it holds my entire DVD collection. It would look good in a college dorm but I put it in a closet (I didn't want DVD's on display). Because it is not too wide, I expect the shelves will not sag. All the parts were included, the item was well packaged, and it arrived promptly.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieD

customer_reviews.title: For particle board furniture it does it’s job.
customer_reviews.text: This product was actually pretty easy to put together. I was surprised at how sturdy it felt when all was said and done and it was together. For a cheap little particle board shelf it’s pretty decent quality wise. I plan on buying a few more
customer_reviews.author: g0dsm4cker

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Rip-off.I bought it because I needed a media tower and this was the only one I found,even after exhausted search. As soon as I began assembly I could tell how flimsy it was.Now assembled I dare not move it, as it's likely to come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Don Carlile

customer_reviews.title: Take your time and have everything laying out before you put it together then its really easy.
customer_reviews.text: I like my shelving units, this is my 2nd one now ...and I would buy another one without any problems. I also might add if I may on the 2nd one we had a missing part and right away was exchanged and with no problems it was so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Anita L. Van Brocklin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little media tower for a good price. I like that it's tall and slim and it's easier to find a spot to put it than the wide ones.
customer_reviews.author: hobbit

customer_reviews.title: Good budget shelves
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. Feels sturdier than similar shelves I've bought at Walmart in the past. Easy, clear assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Tartsonawire

customer_reviews.title: Well designed unit
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. It's just what was at just the right time. Holds the dvds intended for it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: well plleased customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my elementary music classroom. Easy to assemble with screwdriver and small hammer. A bit worried about stability, but should be okay as long as it stays in one place. Adjustable shelves are useful for CDs and DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: Becky H

customer_reviews.title: No problems, it's not heavy but assembled its more than adequate.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the previous reviews and took a shot at this. I really have no idea how anyone had any problems assembling this. All I can say is I'm having another one in its way. I underestimated how many id's i have.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing! Shelves are WAY to shallow. Holds an old CD size, no books for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing! Shelves are WAY to shallow. Holds an old CD size, no books for sure.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Went together easily
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Went together easily. I did put gorilla glue in each of the wooden peg holes, which was not part of the instructions, but I've found from past experience that procedure helps keep the furniture from wobbling or falling apart. It's just what I looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, holes mismatched. Had to modify and alter to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disaster order and waste of money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 shelves and they were so flimsy and didn’t stay upright after assembling. I wish I could return them but I can’t. I am extremely dissatisfied and wasted my money. 😡😢👎
customer_reviews.author: Marie R.

customer_reviews.title: Houses lots of CDs
customer_reviews.text: The description on this bookshelf says it is wood, so we bought two of these instead of one of the double shelves from the same company that were listed as wood composite. Not the case, it is a wood product - not solid wood. It serves the purpose, housing our CD collection. As it sits on a wood floor we elected not to use the wall anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing games or movies.
customer_reviews.text: Used mine for Nintendo WII and PlayStation 3 games. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: James Pinson

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to assemble, looks nice. Holds my dvds. The color is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: nice little shelf
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a nice little cheep shelf. A bit wobbly but they give you a wall anchor. I would buy it again. AP
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Petty

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible horrible! I was excited when I first opened it. It seemed good quality and durable. The assembly is also very easy and straight forward. After i assembled everything was loose and wobbly!!! One of the particle boards split and the shelves are not as deep as I expected! The dimensions mentioned say 8 inches deep but only the bottom piece is 8" all the other shelves at 6 in. So dissapointed!!
customer_reviews.author: eb23

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the shelves for DVD storage. Great buy, really like them. Assembly is easy. Directions could be a little more detailed. If you hadn't assembled shelves like this before, you might not know at first sight exactly how to put the cams in. I had, and found assembly fairly straightforward. Note: The directions tell you to use screws to attach the back when, in fact, they mean "nails" which are supplied. Thoroughly happy with the finished product. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Small dvd holder
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a little bigger than what it is. But it's full of some of my DVD's. It was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Lorri Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Nice small dvd case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small space in my craft room to store DVD cases in it. It works perfectly. Great shape when it arrived and it is pretty sturdy - doesn't move around even on carpet. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Atlantic 74735728 Oskar 261 Media Tower P2
customer_reviews.text: A Very nice DVD tower. Easy to assemble, all you need is a #2 Phillips screwdriver,a hammer. Took me about 30 min to assemble. I ended up with 6 shelves.The base footprint only takes up 13", so it fits in small spaces. I used wood glue with the wooden dowels, just to give it that little extra tightness. I also used the wall mount kit to attach it at the top to the wall. As it sits very close to my Sony big screen(65"). I would recommend this unit to anyone looking for a nice looking DVD holder and the price can't be beat either @ only $36.68. I also had extra shelves & supports left over.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: I read the dimensions and bought according to what i read. My bad. The only shelve 8 inches is the foot or bottom piece. Shelves are 5 1/2 inches. I wanted to store a few books on it and just wantv anyone considering a purchase to be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Arley Running

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Media Cabinet
customer_reviews.text: It's just want I wanted and needed!!! Thank you for getting this to me so quickly!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Mae M. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great for Other Uses
customer_reviews.text: I run a home bakery and I use this to store/display my huge collection of sprinkles. I like that the shelves aren’t so deep that the little jars get shoved behind others; you can still see every color at a glance. It also fits into a closet or small space.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Fits exactly in the space alotted, looks nice and serves its purpose. It's by no means a Harding furniture item but worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: W.SpiritHawk

customer_reviews.title: A good, sturdy unit
customer_reviews.text: A good, sturdy unit for storing DVDs (for those of us who still collect them). Easy to assemble, and all of the parts were clearly labeled (the specific small pieces are in individual plastic bags, so you can line everything up easily. You can mount the unit to a wall, but I've found that it holds up pretty well - and doesn't wobble - without the extra attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great for small storage space
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a small closet. We stored all our CDs in alphabetically
customer_reviews.author: 2Di4amazon

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I put my cds in this case, and it doesn’t take up too much room
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in half easily. I wasted my money on two of these
customer_reviews.text: Very Filmsy. Breaks in half easily. I wasted my money on two of these.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C Carrollo

product_meta.title: Atlantic Summit Adjustable Media Cabinet - Holds 261 CDs, 114 DVDs or 132 Blu-Rays, 6 Adjustable and 3 Fixed Shelves PN74735728 in Maple
product_meta.description: Colorj:Maple| Pattern Name:SingleAtlantic 74735728 Summit Cd/Dvd Shelf
feature_bullets: ADJUSTABLE SHELVING: With 5 adjustable shelves and 3 fixed shelves, you can adjust placement of the shelves and customize according to your specific needs
SPACE SAVING DESIGN: The Summit was designed for placement and use in small compact spaces for the most efficient use of space

MULTI-FUNCTIONAL: The possibilities are endless when it comes to using the Summit media cabinet. It can be used as a CD storage cabinet, DVD storage tower, or a place to display your books and keepsakes
ADDED STABILITY: The wide base feature on the Summit bookcase measures 13”W x 8.5”D. A wall anchor is also included which allows for added stability. It can be used on carpet and wood flooring

ORGANIZED MEDIA: The Summit media storage cabinet is great for DVD storage, Blue Ray discs, video games, books, CD’s, and keepsakes. It can store up to 261 CD’s, 114 DVD’s, or 132 Blue Ray discs * DIMENSIONS: Length: 13.0", Width: 8.03", Height: 54.13"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars686 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
